review_title: A lot of good people work here
pros: Fun environment, great resources, therapists get a lot of time for documentation/planning/collaboration. Management has some issues, but the resident physician is great. Pay is decent for the location. Lots of support from the team. Great therapy is done here with a ton of individual therapy.
cons: Relatively new company, still figuring some things out, poor training of therapy assistants, few systematic protocols for operations. Great place for learning/teaching.

pros: Relatively straight forward documentation system, good clinical staff, great patients.
cons: Terrible management - unethical for profit and disconnected from therapy team. Unprofessional email etiquette from program director ..........

review_title: Would not send a loved one to TLC Galveston
pros: Great variety of patients to learn from and be part of the miracles of their recovery.  Incorporate neuropsychology to address the whole person.  Certain staff members are very caring and dedicated to helping unlock patients' potential.  Use new technology for research and treatment.  Good fostering of patient comeraderie to support one another.
cons: Poor communication among staff, poor communication between staff and medical director, and poor communication to patient families.  I saw many minor health problems grow to critical issues because they were not addressed early, due to inconvenience to the staff of a "someone else's problem" attitude.  Many ethical situations arose in which the staff disagreed with decisions but did not want to go against the powers that be, to the patients' detriment.   Buildings out of date and not fully up to code (outdated fire evacuation equipment in residential building, no fire sprinklers in rehab gym, etc).
